---
title: Command: km-kvk2ldml
---
<!-- DO NOT MODIFY THIS FILE!  It was generated by help2md 1.48.4. -->

### Summary

Convert a Keyman on-screen keyboard file to LDML

### Syntax

```bash
km-kvk2ldml [-h] [-p] [-k] [-o LDMLFILE] [--version] [-v] [-vv] kvkfile

Neither sentry-sdk nor raven is available. Not enabling Sentry error reporting.
```

### Description


Convert a Keyman kvk on-screen keyboard file to an LDML file. Optionally print
the details of the kvk file.

### Parameters

`kvkfile`\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;kvk file

`-h`, `--help`\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;__optional__\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;show this help message and exit

`-p`, `--print`\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;__optional__\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;print kvk details

`-k`, `--keys`\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;__optional__\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;if printing also print all keys

`-o LDMLFILE`, `--output LDMLFILE`\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;__optional__\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;output LDML file location

`--version`\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;__optional__\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;show program's version number and exit

`-v`, `--verbose`\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;__optional__\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;verbose logging

`-vv`, `--veryverbose`\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;__optional__\
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;very verbose logging
